What's happening this weekend?

Trolley hops, shopping specials, ping pong tournement, Indie Rock and and a fencing flick. Five weekend events to get you out on the town

What's happening this weekend?

Kirby Adams, The Courier-Journal 10:44 a.m. EST November 6, 2014

C-J columnist Kirby Adams, left, was challenged by Jack Chauvin, a student at St. Margaret Mary School, to the 90-second Pushup Challenge. Chauvin’s official Pushup Challenge event is Saturday and you are invited. (Photo: Michael Clevenger/The Courier-Journal )

CONNECT 2 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

For your weekend: some freebies, a challenge, awesome music and a flick not to be missed.

Shop local

Join the Shops around the Vogue, Chenoweth Square and other surrounding businesses as they light up for the holidays during the St. Matthews Holiday Walk.

You are invited to sip, shop and stroll the different shops with friends and family and help kick off the holiday season.

Friday, 6-9 p.m., The Vogue in St Matthews and Chenoweth Square Shops, 3729 Lexington Road; (502) 899-3729.

Remember the First Friday Trolley Hop through downtown Louisville's shops, galleries bars and restaurants.

This month's Hop includes a special "Day of the Dead" celebration. The Hop runs 5-11 p.m. and you may pick up the trolley along the Main, Market and South Fourth streets corridor.

AROUND TOWN: 5 fun things this week

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music

Justin Townes Earle and Corey Branan at Headliners Music Hall

Nashville-based artists, Justin Townes Earle and Cory Branan, will be performing together Friday night. Doors open at 8 p.m. at Headliners Music Hall, 1386 Lexington Road. Tickets are $20 click here or call (502) 584-8088 for more information.

Table tennis anyone?

The Ultimate Paddle Battle against Type 1 diabetes is happening Saturday at 1 p.m. at the BBC Brewery at 636 E. Main St.

Come out and watch your friends ping-pong their way to cash, prizes and a trophy. While you watch the action, enjoy pizza by the slice, courtesy of Bearno's, and $3 pint beer specials from BBC.

... or how about fencing?

Sunday at 7:30 p.m., producer and director Sean Anderson will screen his documentary "People in the Room." The film tells the story of Amgad Khazback, one of the most prominent fencing instructors in the world and the founder of Bluegrass Fencers' Club based in Lexington.

The screening will be held in the Wilkinson Room at the Galt House Hotel and coincides with the U.S. Fencing Association's November tournament being held Friday through Monday at the Kentucky International Convention Center.

CONCERTS: Top shows to check out

ON STAGE: 5 performances now playing

TAKE THE KIDS: 2 fun things for families

Put your hard work at the gym to good use

You spend hours each week at the gym, now how about showing off those strong biceps and triceps and helping a really cool local kid achieve a pretty weighty goal.

In recognition of Veterans Day, people of all ages will do as many pushups as possible in just 90 seconds. The goal is to do a cumulative 5,000 pushups, Louisville's "contribution" to the national goal of 1.4 million push-ups — representing the number of America's active duty military.

The group pushup session is Saturday at 10 a.m. at 7701 Greenlawn Road. All are welcome.

Watch a practice session where the organizer of the event, 12-year-old Louisvillian Jack Chauvin, showed me how it's done.
